lines.text: [Bond walks into a Greek Confessional Booth]
Forgive me, Father, for I have sinned.

[Removing disguise]
That's putting it mildly, 007!
The Chinese have a saying; "Before setting off on revenge, you first dig *two* graves"!
I don't expect you to understand, you're English, but I'm half Greek and Greek women like Elektra always avenge their loved ones!
Him? He thinks I'm still a virgin.
Yes. Well, you get your clothes on... and I'll buy you an ice cream.
You may need this.
[returns Bond's pistol to him]
I'm a good judge of man. You have what the Greeks call "thrausos" - guts!

[points his gun at Columbo]
So have you, Mister Columbo.
You left this with Ferrara, I believe.
[kicks the car, making it fall from the mountain and therefore killing Locque]
He had no head for heights.
[Blofeld dangles from a helicopter]
Put me down! Put me down!
Oh, you want to get off?
[Bond drops Blofeld down a giant smokestack]
I love a drive in the country. Don't you...?
I trust you had a pleasant "fright"!
Courage is no match for an unfriendly shoe, Countess...
That's a laugh. Everyone knows it builds up muscle tone.
Well, how about you build up a little more muscle tone by putting on your clothes?
Don't you like me?

[wearily]
Why, I think you're wonderful, Bibi... But I don't think your uncle Aris would approve.

[scoffs]
Him? He thinks I'm still a virgin.
Yes, well...
[to Gen. Gogol, after throwing the ATAC system over a cliff]
That's detente, comrade; *You* don't have it, *I* don't have it.
[Gen. Gogol laughs]
You know what I'd like?
I can't imagine.
A moonlight swim.

[Calling on Bond's wristwatch phone]
007, are you there? Bond? Bond? Bond, are you there? Bond?

[to Bond]
For your eyes only, darling.
[Melina drops her robe to the ground leaving her completely naked]

[after mauling Bond with kisses]
Don't you ever come up for air?
That's why I'll win the gold medal. Breath control.
Yes, well... you can't lose!
[first lines]
Mr. Bond, Mr. Bond. I'm so glad I caught you. Your office called. They're sending a helicopter to pick you up. Some sort of emergency.
It usually is. Thank you.
Farewell Mr. Bond, but not goodbye...
[Bond and Melina are to be keel-hauled]

[seeing Bond's injury]
Bind that wound. We don't want any blood in the water.

[smirks]
Not yet!
Murderer!
*You* have shot your last bolt, Miss Havelock!

[to his man]
Oh, leave the legs free. They'll make appetizing *bait*.
We are five men.
And a woman!

[after the ski chase]
I took the scenic route.
A nose, Q, not a banana.
Mr Bond! We can do a deal! I'll buy you a delicatessen! In stainless steel!
[to Melinda, who drives the Citroën 2CV]
Take the low road!
[Melinda steers to the right and the 2CV hits a curve and literally tips over, ending up on its roof]
Not that low!
[to Blofeld]
All right, keep your hair on!
What did Columbo whisper to you at the restaurant?
That you were a spy, and to find out more about you.
And have you?
Have I *ever*.
You were supposed to question Gonzales, not let Miss Havelock perforate him!
I quite agree, sir.
I'm afraid we have to inform the Prime Minister that Operation Undertow is dead in the water. Why... she'll have our guts for garters!
Think twice 007, it's a long way down.
[last lines]

[over the phone]
Ah, Mr. Bond. I wanted to call you personnally and to say how pleased we all are that your mission was a success. Thank you.
Thank you, thank you.
Don't thank me, Mr. Bond. Your courage and resourcefulness are a credit to the nation. Denis and I look forward to meeting you. Meanwhile, if there is anything I can do for you...
Give us a kiss, give us a kiss.
Well, really, Mr. Bond.
I think we're having a little trouble with the line, madam.

[to Q]
You idiot. Get on to him.
Bond! Have you gone mad? What's going on? Bond. Bond! BOND!
The odds favour standing *pat*...
*If* you play the odds!
Now, if we could identify that 'someone'...
Why don't you try the identigraph?
Mmm!
Yes, sir.
Well get cracking, 007!
Mmm!

[Bewildered]
Minister...
I'm afraid we're being out-horse-powered!
[Kristatos has just acquired the ATAC]
I'll deliver it to my associates in Moscow and return with the money.
Huh! Like I trust you... the voice of the KGB. Our arrangement was that we meet at a place designated by ME! After they pay, I'll give the transmitter to them.

[to Apostis]
It must not be let out of your sight, Apostis.
Nor mine, Herr Kristatos! Where are we going?
We will take the ATAC to St. Cyril's.
St. Cyril's? All right... I'll arrange the pickup.
Cheers!
Yasso!

[after a shark swims past them]
I hope he was dining alone!
Ferrara.
Bond, James Bond.
Luigi.
I think we're having a bit of trouble with the line, Madam...
My God Jack. How deep is the water there?
Not deep enough, I'm afraid!
If I don't report in by tomorrow, not only will my people, but the entire Greek police, will come down on you like a load of bricks.
By tomorrow, we'll be good friends. Let us drink to that.
I'll wait until tomorrow.

[after playing the recorded conversation of Kristatos and Bond]
I'm here, Mr. Bond of the British Secret Service. But I'll tell you it is Kristatos you want, NOT me. He told you about himself. He's the one with the powerful connections. Locque works for him, not me. I smuggle, yes. I smuggle gold, diamonds, cigarettes, pistachio nuts... but no heroin.
James!
Moneypenny, a feast for my eyes!
What about the rest of you?
Well, I was going to get around to that.
A Walther PPK. Standard issue. British Secret Service. License to kill - or, be killed. Take him away.
Oh, by the way, we haven't been properly introduced, Melina. My name is Bond, James Bond.
007, try not to muck it up again.
I'll do my best, sir.
Don't they have showers at the ice rink? How did you get in here?

[Gets into Bond's bed]
One of the porter's is a fan. He'll do anything for me. And I'll do anything for you.
Well, I'm exceedingly flattered, Bibi. But you're in training.
That's a laugh. Everybody knows it builds up muscle tone.
There's Eric Kriegler!
The East German champion?
Isn't he beautiful?
You know something, Bibi, you're fickle.
Bibi! It is time for your rub down.
Oh, I could eat you up alive! Farewell, Mr. Bond. But, not goodbye.
Apéritif, please?
Ouzo for me, please.
This may be an opportunity.
This may be a trap.
If you play the odds.
Allow me. May I drive you home?
No. Thank you. I'll take a taxi.
No courage? Seriously, you may have a job finding one this time of night.
Well, you look like a gentleman. Why not?
May I call on you tomorrow, Countess?
I'm a night person. I have champagne and oysters in the fridge. Why not come in for a bite?

[Raises her champagne glass]
Cheers!
Bottom's up.
Whoops! Me nighty's slipping.
So is your accent, Countess. Manchester?
Close, Liverpool.
I didn't think it would end like this.
We're not dead yet. Hold tight.
I'm supposed to be skating - in Oslo - in Innsbruck. What are we doing in this creepy place?
Our plans have changed! We are going to live in Cuba for a few months.
Cuba?
You can skate privately, without distractions. I will be your audience.
What a drag that'll be. I want to win the gold medal!
We all want that!
I know what you want - and you're too old for me. I'm splitting!
